definition: of or relating to the most highly developed stage of an earlier civilisation and its culture, traditional genre of music conforming to an established form and appealing to critical interest and developed musical taste
details:
adjective
- of or relating to the most highly developed stage of an earlier civilisation and its culture
= synonyms: classic
- of or pertaining to or characteristic of the ancient Greek and Roman cultures
= example: of or pertaining to or characteristic of the ancient Greek and Roman cultures
= synonyms: classic, Greco-Roman, Graeco-Roman, Hellenic
- of recognized authority or excellence
= synonyms: classic, definitive, authoritative
- (language) having the form used by ancient standard authors
= example: (language) having the form used by ancient standard authors
- of or relating to the study of the literary works of ancient Greece and Rome
= example: of or relating to the study of the literary works of ancient Greece and Rome
noun
- traditional genre of music conforming to an established form and appealing to critical interest and developed musical taste
= synonyms: classical music, serious music
